title: Sweden, Pakistan celebrate 75 years of diplomatic ties
content:
ISLAMABAD, May 29 (APP): The Embassy of Sweden in Pakistan hosted a reception on Thursday, at the Swedish Residence to commemorate Sweden’s National Day and 75 years of diplomatic relations between Sweden and Pakistan.
The event brought together senior government officials, business leaders, civil society members, and the diplomatic community to celebrate this significant milestone.
During the event, the Embassy launched a commemorative book titled “75 Years of Partnership – Sweden and Pakistan,” accompanied by a mini book exhibition. The book and exhibition highlighted key milestones in diplomatic relations and showcased the contributions of Swedish companies in Pakistan, including over 40 active companies operating across diverse sectors.
Guests enjoyed a live musical performance by local artists, featuring Swedish music. Ambassador Alexandra Berg von Linde emphasized the importance of the partnership between Sweden and Pakistan, stating, “Our common journey is a story of many voices.”
Chief Guest Federal Minister for Information Technology and Telecommunication, Ms. Shaza Fatima Khawaja, expressed Pakistan’s appreciation for its longstanding relationship with Sweden, particularly in technology, innovation, and sustainability.
She looked forward to strengthening this partnership further, especially in advancing digital transformation and inclusive growth.
The Embassy of Sweden in Pakistan looks forward to continued collaboration in areas such as trade, climate action, innovation, education, and gender equality, reinforcing Sweden’s commitment to a strong and forward-looking relationship with Pakistan.
